intro: Guatteria parveana, commonly known as the small guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are small, white or pale green, and arranged in clusters, often with a fragrant scent. Guatteria parveana typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in shaded environments with high humidity.
